projectPurpose: To provide a native, high-performance, and modular 2D and 3D physics engine specifically designed for seamless integration with the Bevy game engine using its Entity Component System (ECS), offering an ergonomic and Bevy-idiomatic physics solution.
mainFeatures: ECS-driven design, integrates natively with Bevy's Entity Component System
Dynamic, kinematic, and static rigid bodies
Linear and angular velocity, forces, torque, and impulses
Constraints and joints (fixed, distance, prismatic, revolute, spherical, custom)
Transform interpolation and extrapolation for fixed timesteps

alternatives.name: PhysX (Nvidia)
mainFeatures: Soft body dynamics (cloth, fluids, deformable objects)

alternatives.name: Havok Physics
mainFeatures: Wide range of constraints and joints

marketPositioning: Avian is uniquely positioned as a native, ECS-driven 2D/3D physics engine built specifically for the Bevy game engine. While general-purpose physics engines like Rapier, Box2D, Bullet, PhysX, and Havok exist and are widely used across the industry, Avian's core strength lies in its deep integration with Bevy's architecture, aiming to provide a more ergonomic, performant, and idiomatic physics solution for Bevy developers compared to using wrappers around external libraries. It competes directly within the Bevy ecosystem by offering a comprehensive feature set tailored to the engine's data-driven design.
